title: (Update) Wounded man flown to hospital from firing range
content:
A person who was injured in a firing range accident was airlifted to a regional hospital, but a person at the scene said the injury was not believed to be life threatening.
The injured person was believed to be a retired law enforcement officer, according to Marcus Huber, secretary/treasurer of FOP Lodge No. 40. The firing range is in Berlin along County Road 1603. The man was shot in the leg in what was described as an accidental, self-inflicted would.
The Cullman County Sheriff's Office will investigate the incident, which occurred about 10:35 a.m. today.
